questions.question: I call my mother every ..................
questions.description: We use a singular noun after every.

questions.question: There were shops on ............................ side of the street.
questions.description: Each is used to speak of two or more people or things. Every is used to speak of more than two people or things.

questions.question: The two brothers love ............................ other.
questions.description: The correct expression is each other.

questions.question: Everyone ............................. arrived.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after every and everyone.

questions.question: She gave them ............................ a kiss on the forehead.
I looked in ............................... cupboard but I could not find the photo.
I spoke to .............................. of the parents there.
questions.description: We cannot use every before of.

questions.question: I would like to meet ................................ of them.
questions.description: We can use each or every one before of.

questions.question: ................................ was delighted to hear the news.
I enjoyed ............................. minute of the holiday.
I have read .................................. of the books on that shelf.
questions.description: We cannot use every before of.

questions.question: I know ................................... of them.
questions.description: We can use each or every one before of.
